summary:
Hello.  Today someone on Mastodon asked about job control (fg, bg, Ctrl+z,
wait, etc).  It made me think about how I don’t use my shell’s job
control interactively very often: usually I prefer to just open a new terminal
tab if I want to run multiple terminal programs, or use tmux if it’s over ssh...
title: Reasons to use your shell's job control

summary: A list of arbitrary things that make me happy ranging from people who tip generously to wait staff to getting surprise emails from people who read my blog
title: Make a List

summary:
Mastodon 4. 3 adds support for a newly proposed OpenGraph tag to identify the creator of the link, which looks like this:
<meta property="fediverse:creator" content="@robb@social. lol" />
Mastodon (and hopefully other places in the future) will use this tag to display the author's profile below a shared link like so:

This additional data is also included in the card object as authors of the status API so third party clients can use this to display it in their apps as well:
"card": {	"url": "https://www...
title: Highlighting Journalism with the Fediverse Creator Tag

summary: A response to another blogger's post, sharing a personal connection and a book recommendation
title: Re: To an Unknown Blogger

summary: Hello everybody.  Alex from Immich here and I am back with another development progress update for the project
title: Immich Update - July 2024

summary: My thought process about not having a Blogroll, and the introduction of a Postroll
title: To Blogroll, or to not?

summary:
I completely messed up Robert Birming's #Junited2024 challenge, stumbling half way through but, to make amends and, with less stress to post daily, I'm joining the #JulyReply2024 challenge in the hope of redeeming myself. 
The goal is to reply to other people’s blog posts by creating an entry titled “Re: The original blog title”.  Robert describes it as the post version of answering an email and, in a sense, creating a thread spread over several or more blogs...
title: Re: #JulyReply2024

summary: Forrester Consulting’s recommendations following the 2024 study suggest organizations invest in cloud skills, cost optimization, AI, and more
title: HashiCorp State of Cloud Strategy Survey 2024: Forrester’s key recommendations

summary: We need more options in life than evil versus slightly less evil.  At best, we have two options for any given thing, and any attempt to add more options is met with "why aren't you supporting slightly less evil. " That's not a good motivator...
title: Duopolies Are Just Monopolies
